# Discord Chat Analysis for ğŸ’»â”‚developers

## 1. Summary
The chat primarily revolves around gaming applications built on blockchain technology, specifically using Hyperfy. 3rdEyeVisuals is developing a memecoin-related gambling app, starting with a slot machine, and shared screenshots of their UI and workflow for bundling .hyp files. Ash referenced "Fallen," a PvP game where players stake HYPER tokens and can win or lose them through gameplay. The game mechanics involve inserting tokens, battling other players, and withdrawing winnings. 3rdEyeVisuals also mentioned plans for a "Wipeout" version with a prize pool, preferring PvE over PvP. The discussion touched on development workflows, with 3rdEyeVisuals sharing their process for bundling .hyp files for iterative testing, while Ash mentioned they simply build in-world and download when needed to share.

## 2. FAQ
Q: Anyone create a memecoin related app yet? Like blackjack or poker. Where you can play with a couple buddies. (asked by 3rdEyeVisuals) A: Ash referenced Fallen, a PvP game using HYPER tokens.
Q: How does everyone bundle their .hyp files? (asked by 3rdEyeVisuals) A: Ash mentioned they "simply just build stuff in world and download if i need to share" (answered by ash)

## 3. Help Interactions
Helper: ash | Helpee: 3rdEyeVisuals | Context: Looking for examples of memecoin gaming apps | Resolution: Shared link to Fallen (https://fallen.hyperfy.xyz/), a PvP game using HYPER tokens
Helper: ash | Helpee: 3rdEyeVisuals | Context: Workflow for bundling .hyp files | Resolution: Shared alternative approach of building in-world and downloading when needed

## 4. Action Items
Technical: Implement slot machine functionality | Description: Continue development of memecoin gambling app | Mentioned By: 3rdEyeVisuals
Technical: Create automated JSON generation | Description: Enhance workflow to automatically create JSON files during bundling | Mentioned By: 3rdEyeVisuals
Feature: Develop "Wipeout" version with prize pool | Description: PvE game with gambling mechanics | Mentioned By: 3rdEyeVisuals
Feature: GTA-style game with guns | Description: Clone and customize existing game with GTA elements | Mentioned By: Pete

# Discord Chat Analysis

## 1. Summary
The discussion primarily revolves around Hyperscape, a new game built as a fork of Hyperfy v2. Ash clarifies that Hyperscape uses Hyperfy's core technology but removes features like in-world live-building and scripting to suit its specific needs. This sparked a conversation about the relationship between the two platforms and the ethics of naming a fork with a similar name.

The conversation then shifts to a conceptual discussion about the metaverse. Jayzen proposes that Hyperfy needs a global map to create a true metaverse experience, allowing users to visualize and navigate between worlds. This would create network effects and incentivize builders to use the Hyperfy platform directly rather than forking it. 3rdEyeVisuals suggests this could be implemented as an app that detects portal links between worlds and creates an artificial minimap.

mrtzhckr counters with a different vision, arguing that the metaverse won't be singular but will consist of countless metaverses tailored to specific industries and use cases. The discussion concludes with ideas about implementing a map visualization system, with suggestions ranging from submission processes to bubble maps similar to DEX Screener.

## 2. FAQ
Q: Is Hyperscape going to kill Hyperfy? (asked by cloudAI) A: You can't kill open source (answered by 3rdEyeVisuals)
Q: What is the relationship between Hyperscape and Hyperfy? (asked by Jayzen) A: Hyperscape is a fork of Hyperfy v2, heavily modified but using all the core stuff (answered by ash)
Q: How does Hyperscape differ from Hyperfy? (asked by Jayzen) A: They didn't need in-world live-building and scripting for example (answered by ash)
Q: Will there be a global map for Hyperfy? (asked by Jayzen) A: Unanswered

## 3. Help Interactions
Helper: 3rdEyeVisuals | Helpee: Jayzen | Context: Implementing a global map for Hyperfy | Resolution: Suggested creating an app that detects portal links to other worlds and creates an artificial minimap
Helper: ğ•½ğ–”ğ–šğ–˜ğ–™ğ–†ğ–“ | Helpee: 3rdEyeVisuals | Context: How to standardize detection of new world deployments | Resolution: Suggested a submission process similar to events on v1, with periodic validity checks

## 4. Action Items

Type: Feature | Description: Develop an app that detects portal links between worlds to create an artificial minimap | Mentioned By: 3rdEyeVisuals
